commit.message:
Eregs consolidation (#91)

* Remove submodules

* Include dependency code for site and core

* Create overarching cmcs regulations application

* Run cmcs eregulations as one django application

* Initial patterns for using models in `regulations`

- Updated e2e a11y tests in search to use a smaller search term for
  speed.

* Start pattern for custom templates

Allows for easy seperation of concerns between custom specific templates
and sane defaults.

* Bring supplementary_content out of regcore

supplementary content doesn't depend on anything in regulations core and
relates more to the overarching business of cmcs than anything to
regulations in general

* Removed ApiReader in favor of directly accessing regcore models

* TODO: search results without serializer directly show field names
  (i.e. part__title instead of title). Can this be fixed?

* Bring serverless infrastructure under one file

Static assets are still handled on their own

* Run migrate in github action

* Use psycopg2-binary in serverless

* Remove `values` from SearchIndex search filter

* Expose some filter logic in the views for clarity

* Let search 404 if no data is loaded

* Remove dirs that don't exist from compose

* Copy tested experimental serverless to primary

* Lint python files

* Update code with most recent from regulations-site

* fixup:

- use `url homepage` for return to regulation text in search page
- correctly format `version` for use now that it's a date object

* Remove lint for golang for a separate set of work

* Update make data urls to correct aws gateways

* cleanup unused pieces

Co-authored-by: Caleb Godwin <cgodwin@fearless.tech>
Co-authored-by: Alex Bradley <abradley@fearless.tech>
Co-authored-by: Phil Reese <preese@fearless.tech>
